item.title: Dynamic resolution of upstream servers in nginx
item.description: A “howto” article which details a custom patch created for the community version of NGINX to enable the dynamic DNS resolution of upstream servers. This functionality addresses the challenge of working with cloud load balancers, whose IP addresses can change automatically, a feature not supported in the free version. The patch implements a resolve keyword compatible with the commercial NGINX version, ensuring seamless configuration if a user decides to upgrade. While used successfully in production, the author notes this approach is now outdated and has been superseded by a method using systemd-socket-proxyd.
